poem:
### Puzzle Pieces  

Morning paper spread on the table,  
a white grid waiting, like snow —  
clues sprawled in black ink, vague yet definitive,  
filling the silence with cryptic whispers.  
A prize for answers, if only  
they'd come, letter by letter,  
like birds landing in sequence  
on wire, spelling out  
the name of the wind.
